As per clause 12.2 of Model Concession Agreement (MCA); During the Construction Period, the Concessionaire shall maintain, at its cost, the existing lanels) of the Project Highway so that the traffic worthiness and safety thereof are at no time materially inferior as compared to their condition 7 (seven) days prior to the date of this Agreement, and shall undertake the necessary repair and maintenance works for this purpose" 2 There is also a provision in the Model Concession Agreement for compensation in case of default by the Concessionaire. As per Clause 35.1 of MCA, "In the event of the Concessionaire being in material default or breach of this Agreement, it shall pay to the Authority by way of compensation, all direct costs suffered or incurred by the Authority aS a consequence of such material default, within 30 (thirty) days of receipt of the demand supported by necessary particulars thereof; provided that no compensation shall be payable under Ihis Clause 35.1 for ny breach or default in respect of which Damages are expressly  specified and payable under   this Agreement Or for any consequential losses incurred by the Authority" 3 References have been received regarding non-proper maintenance of the existing lanes during the construction period, It may be noted that there are adequate provisions in the MCA for taking action against defaulting Concessiondires. In case, the existing roads are not maintained in traffic worthy condition by the Concessionaire, suitable action for  maintaining the roads after   issue of necessary notices to the Concessionaire shall be taken and the cost incurred on the maintenance may be recovered from the Concessionaire; 4_ This issues with the approval of Chairman, NHAI kul (S.K, Nirmal) Chief General Manager (Coord) To_ PS to Chairman 2.
